solution_line_template: There are a total of {single_page_spreads} single-page spreads * {double_spread_multiplier} = <<{single_page_spreads}*{double_spread_multiplier}={double_page_spreads}>>{double_page_spreads} double-page spreads.

As these are made up of {pages_per_double_spread} pages each, there are {double_page_spreads} double-page spreads * {pages_per_double_spread} pages = <<{double_page_spreads}*{pages_per_double_spread}={pages_from_double_spreads}>>{pages_from_double_spreads} pages in the double-page spreads.

In total, there are {single_page_spreads} single-pages + {pages_from_double_spreads} double-pages = <<{single_page_spreads}+{pages_from_double_spreads}={total_pages_from_spreads}>>{total_pages_from_spreads} pages in the spreads.

A block of ads is printed every {pages_per_ad_block} pages, so there will be {total_pages_from_spreads} pages / {pages_per_ad_block} pages/block = <<{total_pages_from_spreads}/{pages_per_ad_block}={num_ad_blocks}>>{num_ad_blocks} blocks of ads.
This is a total of {num_ad_blocks} blocks * {ads_per_block} ads = <<{num_ad_blocks}*{ads_per_block}={total_ads}>>{total_ads} ads.
As each ad takes up a quarter of a page, this must create an additional {total_ads} ads * {pages_per_ad} = <<{total_ads}*{pages_per_ad}={pages_from_ads}>>{pages_from_ads} pages.

Therefore, the press has printed {total_pages_from_spreads} pages from the spreads + {pages_from_ads} pages of ads = <<{total_pages_from_spreads}+{pages_from_ads}={total_pages_printed}>>{total_pages_printed} pages.

Since brochures are made up of {pages_per_brochure} pages each, this creates a total of {total_pages_printed} pages / {pages_per_brochure} = <<{total_pages_printed}/{pages_per_brochure}={num_brochures}>>{num_brochures} brochures.
